This is a very interesting response. Perhaps you would like to consider:

1) Very little, if any, blame for the perceived problem was put on the
posters other to note the situation. In fact, the discussion quickly
focused on how to make it easier for people to find the information they need
and make better use of the list.

2) This has quickly launched into a concrete discussion (and beginnings of
action) for improving the documentation available to the community.

(?)

On Tue, 16 Oct 2001, Patrick McGovern wrote:

> wow. i'm so glad this issue came up so we can clear
> the list of all non-junit related email! Jeez...let it
> go! How long have you people been on lists? If you
> can't handle stupid or irrelevant emails you shouldnt
> have subscribed. I've never been on a listserv that
> had all relevant messages...it comes with the
> territory. I am getting tired of the constant messages
> in this particular thread. Day 2 of A bunch of
> know-it-alls trying to inflict their rules on the
> community. If you need to ignore the list because the
> "quality" of the posts dont pass muster with your high
> and mighty standards then by all means please do so.
>
> I must say the only posts that really annoy me are the
> common "this is a test" posts:)...but i just contain
> my rage;)
>
>
> --- Laurent Duperval <lduperval@...>
> wrote:
> > On 15 Oct, Eric Vought wrote:
> > > The FAQ posting/welcome message I talked about in
> > my last message should
> > > tell people how to configure their mail agent to
> > not send twelve billion
> > > attachments and 20 lines of font information ...
> > >
> >
> > I don't remember what the original welcome message
> > is but I know that on
> > news:comp.lang.tcl, when you post the first time,
> > you get a _long_ message
> > with a whole bunch of links and information that new
> > Tcl users can search
> > before asking questions on the newsgroup. Maybe
> > someone has the time to come
> > up with such an automatic message, when new users
> > subscribe.
> >
> > L
> >
> > --
> > Laurent Duperval <mailto:lduperval@...>
